IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDES SKILLED NURSING AND OTHER RELATED HEALTHCARE SERVICES TO THE ELDERLY OF STATEN ISLAND, NEW YORK AND ITS SURROUNDING AREA REGARDLESS OF ABILITY TO PAY.
IRS990.MissionDesc: EGER HEALTH CARE AND REHABILITATION CENTER, A LEADER IN CARE AND SERVICES TO POST-ACUTE, LONG TERM, CHRONICALLY ILL AND RESIDENTS RECEIVING END OF LIFE CARE, STRIVES TO REMAIN RESPONSIVE TO THE DIVERSE NEEDS OF STATEN ISLAND AND THE NEIGHBORING COMMUNITIES REGARDLESS OF ABILITY TO PAY AND SEEKS TO PROVIDE A SAFE, CARING PLACE FOR PEOPLE TO LIVE AND WORK DESIGNED TO ENHANCE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR ALL USING LUTHERAN VALUES AS OUR ANCHOR.
IRS990.Desc: EXPENSES INCURRED IN OPERATING A 378 BED SKILLED NURSING FACILITY AND PROVIDING CARE AND SERVICE TO POST-ACUTE, LONG TERM, CHRONICALLY ILL AND RESIDENTS RECEIVING END OF LIFE CARE REGARDLESS OF ABILITY TO PAY.THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDED 107,100 DAYS OF CARE TO 1,421 PATIENTS DURING 2022.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AMOUNT REPORTED ON LINE 1I REPRESENTS THE PORTION OF MEMBERSHIP DUES PAID BY THE ORGANIZATION TO PROFESSIONAL ASSOCIATIONS AND SIMILAR ORGANIZATIONS ATTRIBUTABLE TO LOBBYING ACTIVITIES.

RESIDENTS' FUNDS ARE HELD BY THE ORGANIZATION ON BEHALF OF THE RESIDENTS. SUCH FUNDS REPRESENT ALLOWANCES RECEIVED BY RESIDENTS AS WELL AS OTHER RESIDENTS' FUNDS DEPOSITED WITH THE ORGANIZATION FOR SAFEKEEPING. THESE FUNDS ARE DISBURSED BY THE ORGANIZATION AT THE REQUEST OF, OR ON BEHALF OF, RESIDENTS FOR THEIR PERSONAL USE.

THE CENTER RECOGNIZES THE EFFECT OF INCOME TAX POSITIONS ONLY WHEN THE TAX POSITIONS ARE MORE LIKELY THAN NOT TO BE SUSTAINED. MANAGEMENT HAS DETERMINED THAT THE CENTER HAD NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT WOULD REQUIRE FINANCIAL STATEMENT RECOGNITION OR DISCLOSURE. THE CENTER IS NO LONGER SUBJECT TO EXAMINATIONS BY THE APPLICABLE TAXING JURISDICTIONS FOR PERIODS PRIOR TO 2019.
COST OF GOODS SOLD REPORTED ON PART VIII, LINE 10B 9,910.
RECLASS OF WORKERS COMPENSATION SETTLEMENT TO PART VIII, LINE 11 2,965,864. RECLASS OF BAD DEBT EXPENSE TO PART IX, LINE 24 1,620,851. RECLASS GOVERNMENT GRANT TO PART VIII, LINE 1E 416,964.
COST OF GOODS SOLD REPORTED ON PART VIII, LINE 10B 9,910.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SOLE MEMBER OF THIS CORPORATION SHALL BE EGER LUTHERAN HOMES AND SERVICES, INC.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SOLE MEMBER HAS THE RIGHT TO APPOINT AND REMOVE MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SOLE MEMBER HAS THE RIGHT TO AMEND THE BY-LAWS AND CERTIFICATE OF INCORPORATION AND APPROVE SUBSTANTIAL TRANSACTIONS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EGER HEALTH CARE AND REHABILITATION CENTER HAS ITS FORM 990 PREPARED BY AN OUTSIDE ACCOUNTING FIRM AND HAS ESTABLISHED THE FOLLOWING REVIEW PROCESS TO ENSURE THAT THE INFORMATION REPORTED IS COMPLETE AND ACCURATE. WHEN THE FORM 990 HAS BEEN PREPARED, REVIEWED BY MANAGEMENT AND IS READY TO BE FILED WITH THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE, IT IS ELECTRONICALLY SENT TO THE BOARD FOR APPROVAL. ONCE THE BOARD HAS APPROVED THE RETURN IT IS FILED WITH THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION IS A SUBSIDIARY WITHIN EGER LUTHERAN HOMES AND SERVICES, INC., A TAX-EXEMPT HEALTHCARE SYSTEM COMPOSED OF A NURSING HOME AND OTHER ENTITIES WHOSE PURPOSE IS TO SERVE THE COMMUNITY ("SYSTEM"). THIS ORGANIZATION AND SYSTEM REGULARLY MONITORS AND ENFORCES COMPLIANCE WITH ITS CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY. ANNUALLY ALL MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES, OFFICERS AND SENIOR MANAGEMENT PERSONNEL ARE REQUIRED TO REVIEW THE EXISTING CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND COMPLETE A QUESTIONNAIRE. THE COMPLETED QUESTIONNAIRES ARE RETURNED TO THE ORGANIZATION AND THE ORGANIZATION'S PRESIDENT/CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER FOR REVIEW. IF NECESSARY, ANY CONFLICTS OF INTEREST ARE THEN REVIEWED AND DISCUSSED BY THE ORGANIZATION'S BOARD OF TRUSTEES. AN INTERESTED PERSON MUST LEAVE THE MEETING DURING THE DISCUSSION OF THAT MATTER THAT GIVES RISE TO THE POTENTIAL CONFLICT AND CANNOT VOTE ON THE MATTER. THE MINUTES OF THE BOARD MUST CONTAIN THE FOLLOWING WITH REGARD TO CONSIDERATION OF ANY MATTER INVOLVING A CONFLICT OF INTEREST THE BOARD MINUTES MUST STATE WHICH TRUSTEES WERE PRESENT FOR THE DISCUSSION AND VOTE, THE CONTENT OF THE DISCUSSION AND ANY ROLL CALL OF THE VOTE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION IS A SUBSIDIARY WITHIN THE EGER LUTHERAN HOMES AND SERVICES, INC., A TAX-EXEMPT HEALTHCARE SYSTEM COMPOSED OF A NURSING HOME AND OTHER ENTITIES WHOSE PURPOSE IS TO SERVE THE COMMUNITY ("SYSTEM"). THE SYSTEM HAS AN EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE ("COMMITTEE") OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. THE COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS OF THE PRESIDENT/CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER ARE REVIEWED BY THE COMMITTEE TO ENSURE FAIR MARKET VALUE COMPENSATION IS PAID. WHERE APPROPRIATE, THE BOARD REVIEWS EXTERNAL COMPARABLE DATA AND SEEKS ADVICE OF THE COMMITTEE TO ENSURE TOTAL COMPENSATION OF THIS INDIVIDUAL IS REASONABLE AT FAIR MARKET VALUE. OTHER MEMBERS OF MANAGEMENT, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THESE REPORTED ON FORM 990 ARE REVIEWED BY THE PRESIDENT/CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER AND THE VICE PRESIDENT OF HUMAN RESOURCES, IN ACCORDANCE WITH JOB PERFORMANCE AND CURRENT FAIR MARKET VALUE SALARY DATA.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS FORM 990 AVAILABLE FOR PUBLIC INSPECTION AS REQUIRED UNDER SECTION 6104 OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. THE RETURN IS ALSO POSTED ON GUIDESTAR.ORG AND OTHER SIMILAR TYPES OF WEBSITES. IN ADDITION, THE FORM 1023, FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION AND BY-LAWS ARE ALSO AVAILABLE UPON WRITTEN REQUEST.
RETURN PROVIDER RELIEF FUNDS -611,050. ASSET RETIREMENT OBLIGATION ACCRETION EXPENSE -30,000. EQUITY TRANSFER FROM EGER LUTERAN HOME AND SERVICES 26,758.

THE ORGANIZATION HAS A COMMITTEE THAT ASSUMES RESPONSIBILITY FOR OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT OF ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND SELECTION OF AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT. THIS PROCESS DID NOT CHANGE FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
